Jazz Pharmaceuticals plc (NASDAQ: JAZZ) is a global biopharmaceutical company whose purpose is to innovate to transform the lives of patients and their families. We are dedicated to developing life-changing medicines for people with serious diseases - often with limited or no therapeutic options. We have a diverse portfolio of marketed medicines and novel product candidates, from early- to late-stage development, in neuroscience and oncology. We actively explore new options for patients including novel compounds, small molecules and biologics, and through cannabinoid science and innovative delivery technologies. Jazz is headquartered in Dublin, Ireland and has employees around the globe, serving patients in nearly 75 countries. For more information, please visit www.jazzpharmaceuticals.com and follow @JazzPharma on Twitter.This is a newly created, fast paced, highly visible role with key accountability that will define and drive our global medical enterprise digital ambition for Jazz Global Medical Affairs. This role reports to the Vice President and Head of Global Medical Affairs.The role will strategically partner with the Therapeutic Areas (TAs), Head of Medical Operations and Effectiveness, Global Medical Promotional and Regulatory Affairs and Regional Medical Affairs.This senior leader will drive the development and execution of our digital agenda and will be accountable for the creation of the Medical Affairs Digital Strategy Framework which will to enable TAs and regions to better deliver patient centric impact and performance.Essential FunctionsAccountable for strategically developing the Global Medical Affairs digital ambition and strategy in close partnership with stakeholders across the TA’s and regionsDrive prioritization and support the delivery of our enterprise digital ambition across Global Medical Affairs and accountable for developing the governance framework to support the workCollaboratively grow the omnichannel scientific strategy, architecture, and infrastructure requirements to fulfil our HCP and Patient Engagement Strategy ensuring alignment and execution through global medical plans as well as regional integrated brand plans From an enterprise digital strategy perspective and in partnership with medical leaders, drive asset prioritization across global activities to develop effective medical omnichannel strategies and engagement to inform critical business decisions (e.g., Medical Launch plans).Developing the necessary core competencies, talent, skillsets, training, and resource models to support digital advocacy in the Global Medical Affairs TeamHelp driving insights and translate content into strategic impact via medical plans for patients, healthcare providers and regulators.Delivers digital solutions for measuring the impact and value of global medical plan execution in collaboration with Head of Operations & Effectiveness and TA’s.Deliver strong customer focus and follow industry digital health care trends to inform present impactful and future thinking and direction of new digital initiatives.Incorporates Jazz’s vision and values in delivering Global Medical Affairs Digital HealthcareRequired Knowledge, Skills And AbilitiesTen plus years of relevant health care experienceAdvance degree required (Masters’ or higher technology -related field, MBA, PharmD, PhD or MD)Preference for experience in both medical affairs and digital leadership rolesAt least 8 years professional experience working in office based global or local medical affairs rolesAt least 5 years of direct line management responsibilityDemonstrate an executive presence, strong business acumen, ability to navigate ambiguity, and manages complexityExperience working in medical affairs at an above country level, In-depth knowledge of Medical Affairs organizations including related operating processes, regulations, and standards.Strong digital and omnichannel technology and operation system knowledgeAn understanding of ability to build strong networks of external and internal expertsHighly developed leadership, networking, communication and influencing skills to work effectively in a complex matrix ONLYJazz Pharmaceuticals, Inc. is committed to fair and equitable compensation practices and we strive to provide employees with total compensation packages that are market competitive. For this role, the anticipated base pay range is $224,000-$294,000. The exact base pay offered for this role will depend on various factors, including but not limited to the candidate's qualifications, skills, and experience.At Jazz, your base pay is only one part of your total compensation package. The successful candidate may also be eligible for a discretionary annual cash bonus or incentive compensation (depending on the role), in accordance with the terms of the Company's Global Cash Bonus Plan or Incentive Compensation Plan, as well as discretionary equity grants in accordance with Jazz's Long Term Equity Incentive Plan.The successful candidate will also be eligible to participate in various benefits offerings, including, but not limited to, medical, dental and vision insurance, 401k retirement savings plan, and flexible paid vacation. For more information on our Benefits offerings please click here: https://careers.jazzpharma.com/benefits
